member.name: MSIPATCHSEQUENCEINFOA

summary.para: The MSIPATCHSEQUENCEINFO structure is used by the and functions.

blockquote.para: [!NOTE] The msi.h header defines MSIPATCHSEQUENCEINFO as an alias which automatically selects the ANSI or Unicode version of this function based on the definition of the UNICODE preprocessor constant. Mixing usage of the encoding-neutral alias with code that not encoding-neutral can lead to mismatches that result in compilation or runtime errors. For more information, see Conventions for Function Prototypes.

member.seealso: Not Supported in Windows Installer 2.0 and earlier

summary.para: Pointer to the path of a patch file, an XML blob, or an XML file.
Qualifies szPatchData as a patch file, an XML blob, or an XML file.

description.para: The szPatchData member refers to a path of a patch file.
The szPatchData member refers to a path of a XML file.
The szPatchData member refers to an XML blob.

summary.para: Set to an integer that indicates the sequence of the patch in the order of application. The sequence starts with 0. If a patch is not applicable to the specified .msi file, or if the function fails, dwOrder is set to -1.
Set to ERROR_SUCCESS or the corresponding Win32 error code.
